summary.notes: Share of disease-causing variants that are nonsense/PTC.

examples.name: Cystic Fibrosis (CFTR)
examples.mechanism: PTC in CFTR causes truncated CFTR protein

examples.name: Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy (DMD)
examples.mechanism: PTC in DMD truncates dystrophin; severe myopathy

examples.name: β-Thalassemia (HBB)
examples.mechanism: PTC reduces β-globin, leading to anemia

examples.name: Hemophilia A (F8)
examples.mechanism: PTC in F8 causes factor VIII deficiency

examples.name: Familial Adenomatous Polyposis (APC)
examples.mechanism: Truncating APC variants drive polyposis risk

examples.name: TP53 (tumor suppressor, somatic)
examples.mechanism: Frequent truncations disable p53 in cancer
